column4: k nipzz: i have copy all of the sources and save the file now what i do next?
What do you need help with?
What sources did you add? what software are you hoping to get?
those are all in the regular repositories.
You probably just hadn't updated it.  You don't need any third party repositories for those things.  What's your sources.list curerntly?
Alright, well, let's solve that problem then, instead of just trying to put a bandaid over the symptoms.
What version of Ubuntu are you using?
alright, Do you still have your original sources.list handy? We'd like to get it back to the default.
alright, go ahead and remove whatever you've got in there now and set it back to default.  Save it, and then in a terminal pastebin the output of the following command: sudo apt-get update
edit your sources.list, and then paste in the default ones
Just delete whatever you've added to it.
alright, save it, and then pastebin the output of sudo apt-get update
right, pastebin the output: http://paste.ubuntu.com/
you pastebin it, get the URL, and give us the URL by saying it in this channel
Alright, so, do you remember any of the packages you thought you didn't have?
Well, I don't think you'll be missing any of them, so, lets go ahead and install build-essential, which will give you gcc and g++, sudo apt-get install build-essential
it's compizconfig-settings-manager
If you're searching for compiz-config-manager, it won't show up, since that's not anywhere in it.
you have access to all of the software in main, restricted, and universe, which is almost everything in the repositories.  I guarantee to you that you'll have 95% of the same results.
what?
sure
pastebin it
there wouldn't be significant additions from those, no.
